ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Definitely got a lot better at Chinese.
I developed the ability to speak, write and read Chinese more fluently.
Better mastery of Chinese

I had learnt Chinese before but this class greatly helped me improve my speaking skills, writing skills and confidence in Chinese. The workload but also the instruction can be intense as we are directly asked questions during the class by the professor. This can be tiring sometimes and require a lot of effort but it also made me better and was key in improving my confidence in speaking Chinese.
I furthered my language learning semester and really felt that I became more comfortable speaking in Chinese for longer periods of time!
Chinese grammar, vocabulary, and culture for L2

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It is a ton of work but the improvement is pretty rapid. I wish maybe that this course was curved because it is really hard and we constantly have tests and presentations.
This course had so much work, I think it would be more helpful to have weekly homework, not nightly.
The course is very organized and my teacher was very engaging.
The course is very well organized, and the professors are very kind and good at teaching.

strengths: high-level instruction (Shen laoshi), canvas exercises and book material and all homework assigned are very well-tied together and ensure that a student fulfilling all of them has great knowledge of each chapter, many chances to improve and practice speaking skills 
weakness: workload, Since it is an everyday class, I felt that the workload could be reduced. For example I felt like there was no need to have an oral presentation for every chapter, maybe one oral presentation every two lessons could work better

The organization of this course is amazing, with each day's work clearly outlined. I also loved the addition of the projects this semester because it is super cool to have three final products at the end of the semester.

Strengths: You meet everyday so the daily language immersion really forces your language skills to improve quickly! The class is mostly structured around learning new content rather than note taking which I really liked.
Weaknesses: Very heavy workload and you learn new content very quickly. It can be hard to stay on top of everything, especially if you struggle with memorization

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. You definitely see rapid improvement.
Yes. I would recommend this course to any student who would like to pursue Chinese.

Yes
It is fun to learn Chinese even though it has a huge workoad
Because the class is so intensive and one learns so much in it, I would. However, I would only recommend this class with an overall light workload because it is so time consuming and challenging.

If a student wants to learn Chinese and reach a high level of language acquisition I would totally recommend taking Chinese at Yale and of course, L2 Chinese with Shen laoshi. I took Chinese L2 not for the language requirement but because I had done it in middle school and I liked it. I don't regret this choice, however it was more intense than I thought it would be, so if a student wants to take one semester of Chinese just for this purpose I would warn them that it is an intense course, especially in terms of workload, but would still encourage them to take it.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. I felt that my sentence fluency really improved this semester and it was exciting to be able to write and speak so much more. Professor Shen is amazing and I love the consistency of practicing a language every day.
Yes! If you are willing to put in the work you will learn a lot of Chinese! The teachers are all so committed and really prioritize you learning Chinese to the best of your abilities
